name: Boutique Hotel Victoria Budapest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Hotel Victoria and were very satisfied. It is a modern hotel with large rooms and nice bathrooms. Did I mention the view. It is right on the Danube and facing the river your room is a wall of glass. You will be blown away by the view of the city across the river at night. That in itself is worth the price. The breakfast is excellent, the best of our entire trip including eggs bacon or omlets cooked to order. We walked into the city across the bridge but I would recommend using the trolley. One stops right in front of the hotel and crosses the river into the city. In Budapest, the hop on hop off bus tour is worth it and highly recommended to see the sights because Budapest is so large. Also the main tourist street Vaca Utca is delightful in the evening for resturants and strolling. The only negative point was that the tile in our shower was not real clean.
reviews.title: The view is worth the price

reviews.text: We stayed with 5 people (three rooms) for 3 nights. The hotel-people were helpful from making the reservations and giving advice on sightseeing and program to making arrangements for celebrating my wife's birthday.
reviews.title: Great location with a view - warm hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable and spacious, have a great view over the river including the parliament, the breakfast is generous. Good value!
reviews.title: Charming hotel on the Danube River.

reviews.text: The location is convenient for exploring the city.
reviews.title: Go For the View and Return For the Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall - a clear will recommend and will repeat.
reviews.title: WOW!! What a view! Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A truly excellent, small, friendly hotel. All rooms are large and have magnificent Danube views. Breakfast is good and cooked breakfast is available on request and at no extra charge. On the quiet Buda side, but the Chain Bridge is just a short walk downstream so access to Pest is good.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: This hotel helps you experience the River Danube first hand. All the rooms look on to the river and you don't need a stool to stand on to get the view - the windows are full length so the view is amazing, both during the day and at night, when the city and Chain Bridge are lit up. The rooms were clean, bright and comfortable.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.text: The breakfast was enough to set you up for a day of walking around the lovely sights of Buda and Pest. The hotel is situated on the Buda side of the Chain Bridge, but it only takes 10 minutes to get to the centre of Pest - just watch out for the cyclists, who wizz past you ringing their bells! The location was perfect to see the sights of both Buda and Pest.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We booked directly through the hotel website, which was very efficient.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location, right on the river. Close to transportation and everything else. Enjoyed our stay there, nice showers and breakfast, made to order eggs included!
reviews.title: View was magnificent for the picture windows.
Our favourite city...7 times in 7 years!
reviews.text: We always stay In Buda, where we feel we see more Hungarian people as they go about their business than in the more touristy and smarter Pest with it's swanky hotels. On our 7th visit to The Hotel Victoria there was a bottle of wine and 2 glasses waiting in our usual room with a card saying, 'Welcome Home'.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of good restaurants in Pest, and also easy access by Metro into Pest to see the many interesting places over there
reviews.title: Super hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh and by the way, for visitors from The EU who are over the age of 65, city transport is free!
reviews.title: Best Views in Budapest

reviews.text: Metro, bus, tram...just hop on and go where you like. Transport Police check for tickets at all Metro Stations but we have only been stopped once. We just said, 'From England, over 65', and they smiled and waved us on.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Hotel Victoria Budapest!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Remember if you are going outside the city limits you will need to buy tickets, though.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel on the riverside!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from 4 days in budapest staying at the Hotel Victoria on the Buda side. Overall the hotel was very good. Rooms large and very clean if not a little dated. Magnificant view of the river especially the Chain Bridge and Parliament Buildings. Breakfast was adequate and set you up for the day. My only worry is that the area in front of the hotel is undergoing a major face lift with the whole main tram line and road under construction. We were lucky that the road works hadnt' reached as far as the Victoria hotel yet but I would think that for a few weeks there will be major disruption going on and a lot of noise.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay at Victoria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on short break, rooms although dated very clean. Breakfasts varied and plentiful. Within walking distance of Chain Bridge and the Pest side. Courtesy room to change clothes before homeward journey very much appreciated by us.
reviews.title: Fabulous views

reviews.text: Only complaints are, there were no tea or coffee making facilities in rooms, bar closed at 10 pm so unable to get a drink after then unless you use mini bar with the usual over inflated prices. Requested a coffee at 10.05 one evening and were refused as bar was closed, we were not offered room service only mini bar, but wanted a coffee!!
reviews.title: Great location, great value

likes.disliked: — The tram line that runs in front of the hotel is out of service currently, but that's not the hotel's fault

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No iron in room either so need to take your own.
reviews.title: Different Views

reviews.text: Just wrapping up my last of three nights in Hotel Victoria. The stay here has been great. Rooms are quite nice, good sized, very clean, comfortable bed, decent breakfast and great staff. Less than a 5 minute walk to the nearest metro station and bus stop. There's a super market located right by the metro station as well. Free wifi access. The view of the Danube is amazing. I checked in around 10:00 PM and when I got up to my room and looked out the window, I couldn't believe the view of the chain bridge, absolutely wonderful!
reviews.title: Great location, great value, great view of Danube

description: The newly renovated Hotel Victoria is located in the heart of historical downtown of Budapest, on the Buda side, directly on the riverside of the Danube. As the facility is equipped with large panoramic windows, one can enjoy the spectacular view of the city from all rooms.
